title: Thanksgiving Celebration
text: Thanksgiving, celebrated on the fourth Thursday of November, is a major U.S. holiday centered around family, gratitude, and a traditional turkey dinner.

title: Dining Etiquette in the UK
text: Ordering food in English restaurants involves polite phrases and an appreciation for British dining customs, like afternoon tea.

text: British business English includes formal greetings and a culture of punctuality and professionalism in meetings.

title: Oktoberfest in Munich
text: Oktoberfest, held annually in Munich since 1810, is the world’s largest beer festival, featuring traditional Bavarian culture.

text: The Carnival of Venice features elaborate masks and costumes, a tradition dating back to the 12th century.

text: Navigating Italian airports involves understanding local customs, like greeting staff politely.

text: Italian expressions like 'In bocca al lupo' reflect the rich cultural heritage of the language.

text: Traveling in France involves knowing phrases for trains, hotels, and local politeness.

text: This annual tomato fight in Buñol, Spain, is a fun festival held every August.

text: The world’s largest carnival, held in Rio de Janeiro, features samba and vibrant parades.
